009package imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.multiply;
013import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.normL2;
014import static java.lang.Math.cos;
015import static java.lang.Math.sin;
016import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
017
018import java.util.Locale;
019
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
021import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
022import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
023
024/**
025 * <p>
026 * Represents an algebraic ellipse with the implicit equation A x^2 + B x y + C
027 * y^2 + D x + E y + F = 0. Parameters A, ..., F are normalized such that B^2 -
028 * 4 A C = -1. Instances are immutable. See Secs. 11.2.1 and F.3.1 for details.
029 * </p>
030 * <p>
031 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
032 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
033 * </p>
034 * 
035 * @author WB
036 * @version 2022/11/17
037 * 
038 */
039public class AlgebraicEllipse {
040        
041        /** Ellipse parameters. */
042        private final double A, B, C, D, E, F;
043        
044        /**
045         * Constructor.
046         * Creates a {@link AlgebraicEllipse} instance by normalizing the
047         * supplied parameters [A,...,F] such that d = B^2 - 4 A C = -1.
048         * Throws an exception if d is non-negative.
049         * 
050         * @param A ellipse parameter A
051         * @param B ellipse parameter B
052         * @param C ellipse parameter C
053         * @param D ellipse parameter D
054         * @param E ellipse parameter E
055         * @param F ellipse parameter F
056         */
057        public AlgebraicEllipse(double A, double B, double C, double D, double E, double F) {
058                double d = sqr(B) - 4 * A * C;
059                if (d > -Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE) {   // discriminant (d) must be negative!
060                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("illegal ellipse parameters, non-negative discriminant " + d);
061                }
062                // d < 0
063                // normalize to B^2 - 4 A C = -1
064                double s = 1 / sqrt(-d);
065                if (A >= 0) {
066                        this.A = A * s;
067                        this.B = B * s;
068                        this.C = C * s;
069                        this.D = D * s;
070                        this.E = E * s;
071                        this.F = F * s;
072                }
073                else {
074                        this.A = -A * s;
075                        this.B = -B * s;
076                        this.C = -C * s;
077                        this.D = -D * s;
078                        this.E = -E * s;
079                        this.F = -F * s;
080                }
081        }
082        
083        /**
084         * Constructor. Creates a {@link AlgebraicEllipse} instance from the
085         * specified parameter vector [A,...,F].
086         * 
087         * @param p algebraic ellipse parameters
088         */
089        public AlgebraicEllipse(double[] p) {
090                this(p[0], p[1], p[2], p[3], p[4], p[5]);
091        }
092        
093        /**
094         * Constructor. Creates a {@link AlgebraicEllipse} instance from
095         * a {@link GeometricEllipse}.
096         * 
097         * @param ge a {@link GeometricEllipse}
098         */
099        public AlgebraicEllipse(GeometricEllipse ge) {
100                this(getAlgebraicEllipseParameters(ge));
101        }
102        
103        private static double[] getAlgebraicEllipseParameters(GeometricEllipse ge) {
104                double ra = ge.ra;
105                double rb = ge.rb;
106                double xc = ge.xc;
107                double yc = ge.yc;
108                double theta = ge.theta;
109                
110                double cosT = cos(theta);
111                double sinT = sin(theta);
112                
113                double A = sqr(ra * sinT) + sqr(rb * cosT);
114                double B = 2 * (sqr(rb) - sqr(ra)) * sinT * cosT;
115                double C = sqr(ra * cosT) + sqr(rb * sinT);
116                double D = -2 * A * xc - B * yc;
117                double E = -2 * C * yc - B * xc;
118                double F = A * sqr(xc) + B * xc * yc + C * sqr(yc) - sqr(ra * rb);      
119                return new double[] {A, B, C, D, E, F};
120        }
121        
122        /**
123         * Return a vector of parameters for this ellipse.
124         * The length of the vector and the meaning of the parameters depends
125         * on the concrete ellipse type.
126         * 
127         * @return a vector of parameters [A, B, C, D, E, F]
128         */
129        public double[] getParameters() {
130                return new double[] {A, B, C, D, E, F};
131        }
132        
133        public double getAlgebraicDistance(Pnt2d p) {
134                double x = p.getX();
135                double y = p.getY();
136                return A * sqr(x) + B * x * y + C * sqr(y) + D * x + E * y + F;
137        }
138        
139        public double getSampsonDistance(Pnt2d p) {
140                double x = p.getX();
141                double y = p.getY();
142                double ad = A * sqr(x) + B * x * y + C * sqr(y) + D * x + E * y + F;    // algebraic distance
143                double nGrad = Math.hypot(2*A*x + B*y + D, 2*C*y + B*x + E);
144                return ad / nGrad;
145        }
146        
147        public double getGoncharovaDistance(Pnt2d p) {
148                double x = p.getX();
149                double y = p.getY();
150                double G = A * sqr(x) + B * x * y + C * sqr(y) + D * x + E * y + F;     // algebraic distance
151                
152                double[] gV = {2*A*x + B*y + D, 2*C*y + B*x + E};
153                double ngV = normL2(gV);
154                double sd = G / ngV;
155                
156                double[][] H = {{ 2*A, B }, { B, 2*C }};
157                double gd = sd * (1 + G * Matrix.dotProduct(multiply(gV, H), gV) / (2 * Math.pow(ngV, 4)));
158                return gd;
159        }
160        
161        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
162        
163        @Override
164        public boolean equals(Object other) {
165                if (this == other) {
166                        return true;
167                }
168                if (!(other instanceof AlgebraicEllipse)) {
169            return false;
170        }
171                return this.equals((AlgebraicEllipse) other, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
172        }
173        
174        public boolean equals(AlgebraicEllipse other, double tolerance) {
175                return 
176                                Arithmetic.equals(A, other.A, tolerance) &&
177                                Arithmetic.equals(B, other.B, tolerance) &&
178                                Arithmetic.equals(C, other.C, tolerance) &&
179                                Arithmetic.equals(D, other.D, tolerance) &&
180                                Arithmetic.equals(E, other.E, tolerance) &&
181                                Arithmetic.equals(F, other.F, tolerance) ;
182        }
183        
184        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
185        
186        public AlgebraicEllipse duplicate() {
187                return new AlgebraicEllipse(this.getParameters());
188        }
189        
190        @Override
191        public String toString() {
192                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s %s", 
193                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), 
194                                Matrix.toString(getParameters()));
195        }
196        
197        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
198        
199//      public static void main(String[] args) {
200//              PrintPrecision.set(9);
201//              GeometricEllipse eg  = new GeometricEllipse(150, 50, 150, 150, 0.5);
202//              System.out.println("eg = " + eg);
203//              AlgebraicEllipse ea = new AlgebraicEllipse(eg);
204//              System.out.println("ea = " + ea);
205//              
206//              Pnt2d p = Pnt2d.from(300, 300);
207//              System.out.println("p  = " + p);
208//              Pnt2d pc = eg.getClosestPoint(p);
209//              System.out.println("pc = " + pc);
210//              
211//              System.out.println("Sampson dist(p) = " + ea.getSampsonDistance(p));
212//              System.out.println("Gonch dist(p) = " + ea.getGoncharovaDistance(p));
213//              
214//      }
215
216}
